nodes.bodyText: nit: we shouldn't check these in if this is a specific checkstyle error to your local environment
For the verify statements in this file, can you use InOrder to verify the calls are being made properly? (we're enqueueing a record, then committing before moving onto the next record.

Do we need to actually split this into two classes? BackupReplayFile and BackupInputFile
It doesn't really look like there's much difference between the two so it's not clear to me why having both is necessary.

There's a slightly difference. The BackupReplayFile opens the file for writing. It fails if there are no permissions for writing. I created the BackupInputFile just for that, so it can open it if only read permissions are set.
